articles.description:
Oct 24, 10:27 PDT
Resolved - This incident has been resolved. The increase in 500 errors occurred between 4:00 a.m. and 7:00 a.m. PDT. Please reach out to us via the Support Portal if you are still experiencing 500 errors.
Oct 24, 05:40 PDT
Investigating - We are having a site wide issue causing 500 errors across all APIs. We are currently investigating, and we will post updates as we have more information.
articles.title: 500 Error Across All APIs

articles.description:
Oct 21, 16:03 PDT
Resolved - We have identified an issue with creating room amenity photos. The issue would cause POST requests to fail with either a 404 error or a 500 error. This issue approximately started from last Friday, October 14th, 2022. The photo creations are successful in most cases but the requests fail at a later stage resulting in error responses.
We have fixed this issue at 3:30pm PT today, but there can be duplicate photos created for room amenities during this time. We advise you to review room amenity photos and use the DELETE endpoint to remove duplicate photos.
We are sorry for the inconvenience.
articles.title: Requests to create room amenity photos failing (Listing Photos POST Request)

articles.description:
Oct 11, 15:58 PDT
Resolved - This incident has been resolved - it was active between around 11:00 and 11:30 am PDT. While the incident was active, you may have noticed an increase in 500 errors across all our endpoints. Hosts and guests might have been unable to access listings through the Airbnb website. We apologize for the inconvenience. Don't hesitate to contact us via the Support Portal if you need additional information.
Oct 11, 12:26 PDT
Monitoring - We have implemented a fix for this issue, and we are now monitoring the results.
Oct 11, 11:57 PDT
Investigating - We are investigating an issue that is preventing the retrieval of some listings and reservation acceptance.
articles.title: Airbnb.com Listing and Payment page Degradation

articles.description:
Incident began at 2022-10-28 16:22 and ended at 2022-11-03 18:30 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

The problem with Google Meet has been resolved. We apologize for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience and continued support.

The fix for the issue is now available in the latest version of Meet iOS app and we recommend customers to upgrade to the latest version of Meet iOS app.

Affected products: Google Meet
articles.title: RESOLVED: We're aware of a problem with Google Meet affecting a significant subset of users. We will provide an update by Oct 31, 2022, 2:00 AM UTC detailing when we expect to resolve the problem. Please note that this resolution time is an estimate and may change.

articles.description:
Issue Summary: 

On Wednesday, November 2nd at 2:12 PM PST to 4:34 PM PST, some users were running into issues with publishing a workflow when using Workflow Builder. Clicking the “Next” button would not return any response, and would cause a workflow to remain in its unpublished state. A new code change had been deployed that caused us to exit early in workflow creation and this is now fixed.
articles.title: Incident: Users having trouble creating a workflow in Workflow Builder

articles.description:
Issue Summary:

On Wednesday, October 26th at 2:15 PM PST Friday to October 28th 9:12 PM PST, some users were unable to view emoji/code previews when hovering their cursor over messages containing emojis. Upon investigation, we discovered that an error had occurred with the jumbomoji (a message with just an emoji) previewer during the process of a backend code-change we were performing related to emoji. Once we learned this, we were able to deploy a fix which rectified this issue for all affected users.
articles.title: Incident: For an emoji sent as a standalone message, the emoji code is not displayed on hover

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On October 28, 2022 from about 1:06 PM PDT to 1:17 PM PDT, some customers experienced trouble loading threads, sending messages, and saving bookmarks.


This issue occurred when we deployed a web app change resulting in an increased database load. We have since rolled back the deploy, restoring functionality for all affected users.
articles.title: Incident: Some users may be experiencing issues sending messages, loading threads, and saving bookmarks

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On October 19, 2022, from 8:17 AM to 10:13 PM PDT, some users saw a "Something went wrong" error when attempting a search query.


This issue was caused by a recent code change that resulted in searches failing. 


We reverted this change, which fixed the issue for all users after a reload of Slack.
articles.title: Incident: Some users are having issues searching in Slack, seeing the "Something went wrong" message.

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On October 13, 2022 from 3:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. PDT, a number of customers had trouble loading and receiving thread notifications. Some customers may have also had trouble with loading channels, adding users to group direct messages, API hyperlink rendering, and missing Saved items.


A mass de-provisioning event inadvertently increased load across our infrastructure, causing issues with Threads for many users. 


As an immediate mitigation strategy, we temporarily deactivated the Threads view for all users. 


In parallel, we ended the long running de-provisioning jobs, and significantly scaled up the systems that handle those jobs. We also made several code changes to reduce the effect a de-provisioning job of this scale would have on our infrastructure, and redistributed some of the load across other parts of the system. 


The optimisation and redistribution work brought error rates down, which resolved most of the issues with channel loading, group direct messages, hyperlinks, and Saved items that users were experiencing. 


At this point, we made the call not to re-enable the Threads view in order to give our recovery efforts more time to restore balance to the system. 


Once the load was appropriately balanced across our infrastructure, and we were able to confirm that our up-scaling systems were prepared to handle any future spikes, we re-enabled the Threads view for all users.
articles.title: Incident: Some users are experiencing issues loading Slack, including the Threads view, Saved items, notifications, API hyperlinks, and group DMs/channels

articles.description:
Issue summary:


Starting around 12:00 AM PDT until 08:30 AM PDT on October 12, 2022, some users experienced issues with connectivity and threads loading.


We discovered that an unusually large number of requests within a short timeframe resulted in a database failure causing errors and slowness.  The issue has since been resolved.


Please contact feedback@slack.com for a Root Cause Analysis if one is required for your team.
articles.title: Incident: Some users may be experiencing issues with loading Slack.

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On October 10, 2022 from 5:04 PM PDT to 11:01 PM PDT, some users experienced issues when switching channels in Slack. This resulted in saved items, threads, mentions and reactions, (as opened on the right-hand side) being hidden immediately.


We identified that the issue was the result of a recent update. We have rolled back this change which has fixed the issue for all impacted users.
articles.title: Incident: When switching channels, items that open on the right-hand side including threads, mentions & reactions, and saved items hide immediately.

articles.description:
Issue summary:

From 12:46 PDT on October 3, 2022 until 7:42 PDT on October 6, 2022, customers on the Free and Pro plans using a confirmation code to log in, saw an invalid code error when entering the code they received by email.


The issue was traced to a recent update. Reverting this update fixed the issue for all affected customer.
articles.title: Incident: Issues with login confirmation codes

articles.description:
Nov  4, 06:05 CET
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.
Nov  4, 05:00 CET
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.
Nov  2, 12:39 CET
Scheduled - Please note there is scheduled infrastructure maintenance on Friday 4th of November, between 5 AM and 7 AM CET, when you can expect a few short service interruptions. During this maintenance following services will be affected:
- Migrations will not be available
- Shared hooks created within maintenance will not be accepted nor processed
- Logins to the platform might be affected
- Registration of new subscribers won't be possible
- Invitations of new team members won't be possible
- E-mails and notifications might be delayed
- Password reset won't be possible
- Payments for subscription plans won't be accepted  
We will inform you once the maintenance is completed.
articles.title: Scheduled infrastructure maintenance

During the maintenance some scenarios processed at that time might be temporarily delayed . 
We do not expect any data loss. We apologise for any inconvenience caused.
articles.title: Emergency Infrastructure Upgrade on EU1
